#b#p1061012##k said the picture on the necklace points to #m910500200#, the deepest part in the entrance of the Shrine. He said that I would find the Singing Shield there. However, he said #m910500200# would be locked so I would have to eliminate #o9500139# to get the key....Will I really get Sayram's shield there? The Insignificant Being tells me to try taking the key I already used for another world to #b#p2040052##k as well...This is getting interesting, I'd better keep my weapon close! 

#i4031471##t4031471# #b#c4031471#/1#k
#i4031475##t4031475# #b#c4031475#/1#k

I went to #b#p2040052##k of #b#m222020000##k to find the singing shield. While talking to the Wiz, Wiz found the skill book from the singing shield. This WAS the great warrior Sayram's skill! I have learned a new technique! Quite unexpected but excellent nonetheless. I shall use this in battle to defeat my enemies!

I looked at the necklace you gave me. Though it was old, there are no spells casted on it. It is painted in details and not damaged at all. It must be valuable. Even a small necklace has value.. Unlike me.. Oh Well...
Sayram had this picture. He painted picture in the necklace to give it to #o8180001#...Is that right?
This picture shows #b#m910500200##k. Do you know? Sayram always kept precious things there. Perhaps you should visit there...
Hmm. Then go to the entrance of the Shrine. There is a way to the #bForgotten Shrine#k inside of the entrance
You have to catch #b#o9500139##k. They have a key. Without #b#t04031475##k, you can't go to #b#m910500200##k. Make sure you get it...
First, get #bSayram's shield#k and take it with the #bKey To Forgotten Shrine#k to #b#p2040052##k who asked for it. Do you wonder how I know all this? Age and wisdom tend to go hand-in-hand.
Are you willing to go there? Then I don't have to say you should go to #m910500200#.

You're looking for a singing shield! #t4031471# means Sayram really existed. What's this key? Ah! Key of the Forgotten Shrine?! Was there really a Forgotten Shrine? If there is enough evidence, then it means that the book is not just a legend, but an ancient book of true adventure! I'm excited.

This is the singing shield. Why isn't it singing? Maybe because he doesn't have his owner? Or is it broken? Or has the spell worn off? I think I can press this button on the side... Looks like I've got something here! A book...? Traveler, do you know about this book?

I see! This is Sayram's technique! I'm surprise to see it in the shield itself. The great warrior left this technique behind. It must be a great one. You deserve to use this technique as you helped a lot to study Sayram's legacy. Please learn this technique and show me what Sayram did.
I hope you live up to the legend of Sayram. Someday, I wish to read a book about your adventures in the library.
Defeat the Junior Balrog at the entrance of the Shrine. They have a Key to #bForgotten Shrine#k.
Haven't you got Sayram's shield? Anyhow, we don't even know if it exists or not...
